byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington, and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: China has toned down its concern about Trans-Pacific Partnership as tempo of negotiations accelerate; trade deal had initially evoked fears in China of commercial encirclement, but some policy experts there now say it could free them to pursue regional agreements without facing criticism for China's reluctance to adopt its own global trade pacts.
lead_paragraph: Some leading Chinese trade policy figures now say the American-led pact could even make it easier for Beijing to pursue its own regional agreements.

headline.main: Once Concerned, China Is Quiet About Trans-Pacific Trade Deal
headline.print_headline: China Quiet as Trade Pact Progresses

snippet: Some leading Chinese trade policy figures now say the American-led pact could even make it easier for Beijing to pursue its own regional agreements.
